- Ensure that your passwords are strong and unique (not re-used across accounts)\n- Consider using a password manager
- Check your email for data breaches using HaveIBeenPwned
- Consider using security methods such as biometrics on your smartphone and in-app\n- Consider using a one-time password app for multi-factor authentication
- Consider removing SMS (text message) authentication if possible, as it is insecure and vulnerable to various attacks
- Review your Single Sign-On (SSO) linked accounts and ensure they are properly protected
- Consider adding a physical security key as an account recovery method
- Keep backup codes stored securely\n- Ensure your security question answers are up-to-date and not easily discoverable by strangers

This app is an online accounts manager, but not a password manager. Its primary purpose is to act as a record of what security methods you have on your accounts, and identify any potential issues with those.
Please note that this app is currently designed and intended for use on handheld portrait-oriented mobile devices such as smartphones and tablets.
First add an online service that you have an account(s) with the "Manage Services" page. Enter its name and website domain and save.
Next, add an account using "Manage Accounts". Select the service, then enter the methods for how you login - if its a Single Sign-On (SSO), select the parent account.
Also select what security methods you use for accessing the service, such as a password and/or phone login (text messages) for their website, or biometrics (fingerprint, face ID) on their app.

Once that\'s saved, you can edit it later using the same page, or view the record using "View All Accounts". These pages have an option to open \'HaveIBeenPwned\' to check if your email has been involved in a data breach.
You can also view any security alerts using the "Alerts" page. The settings page will let you control the weekly notifications that will appear if you have unresolved alerts.
